item.title: Cleans away all darkness
item.description:
Across the stars,
Down to earth,
In the heart,
Truth be heard.
This day was dark,
But dawning light,
Tis the Buddhas Words,
That give us practice's sight,
Feet on the Path, is our True fight.
Not to fear,
No lonely heart,
The Dhammas real,
It takes out the dart.
Mara's hordes,
Have no chance to keep us caught.
So we are to break the bonds,
Of worldly toil.
The luminous heart,
that virtue brings,
Generous and bright
That goodness sings.
For here we tread and toil,
With all our might to bear.
Tis the Buddhas realm of wisdoms,
That is beyond all compare.
So let no darkness bind us,
Let no ignorance hold.
For upright Truth, will be found withinus,
When we give our all.
Let not fear, nor sloth, nor idleness creep in,
The light of the sun, is like the Buddhas sphere.
To tame and point the way, that's The Teachers Mark,
All those beings will to Train,
Give-up to the Magnificent One.
Tis possible that we might be weak at times,
But if we recall the taste of
Wisdom and Peace that has been felt
We will know the way, and know right friends true.
Best of friends is the Buddha,
Best of friends is Dhamma True,
Best of friends are those who well practiced,
Best of friends is our inward proper use.
Setup the light in the heart of Darkness,
Keep it bright and clear,
Let the Dhamma guide us,
Beyond the snares and traps of Mara's lair.
No matter the deceptions,
Not matter if upset,
Put down all Wrong Views promptly,
Give up the the Higher Quest.
Rightly forward one foot forward,
Rightly on breath True.
All conditions known as just temporary,
The stigmata show us the Deathless Way.
So each must bridge over this inner darkness,
Each must tread with care and light.
That the Way be followed,
That brings true practice and insight.
Don't be deceived by a culture,
Don't follow shadows of decay,
Just be a spiritual warrior,
for following totally the Buddhas Way.
So now to see the water,
That Nibbana's End is true,
Countless Eons no more needed,
If we give our life in earnest use.
Without resolve we can not go forward,
Without forgiveness we cannot no peace,
Without tranquillity no solitude will help us,
Without Wisdom, no end can we meet.
So give up to the world of the practice,
Don't believe our own views and thoughts are right,
Like sliver and gold, doth dross come,
So purity shall be ones spiritual might.
Cleans away all darkness,
Wash away wrong views,
Brighten up all precepts,
So one is like the shinning full moon.

item.title: To Know True Peace
item.description:
Beyond the darkness,
Beyond the blue,
The heart of Dhamma,
Is so True.
True to kindness,
True to care,
Built on Lord Buddhas wisdom,
The power of his compassionate welfare.
Tis ardour in practice,
Gumption in peace,
Recollecting good action,
Ending mental disease.
... No names can then bind us,
... No signs can sway our hold,
Perfect in Sīla,
Perfect in Resolve.
No matter the barrier,
No matter the lair,
Mara will not hold us,
For the Well-Farer’s,
Teachings are close to bear.
Aligning in that goodness,
Waking up to inner strength,
Enduring patiently all contact,
The silent heart is best.
Whatever shackles bind us,
The Teacher taught all worldly flaws.
Overcoming our own weakness,
Recollect the Dhamma Ever-more.
Sati is the light force,
Sīla the inner guide,
Saddhā sparks that courageous endeavour,
& Paññā brings Mara’s demise.
No matter what the world says,
No matter how we feel,
The Teacher Taught us earnestness,
That it be imbued in the fabric of our weal.
From this brick & mortar,
From this blood & bones,
All lust and covetousness abandoned,
All anger and hatred without a home.
Greatness in peacefulness our station,
Greatness in fortitude our zeal,
From this skeleton of action,
The Kinsman of the Sun;
Shows us the Path that is Real.
Real to Right Intention,
Real to the 8 fold Path,
No matter the time of practice,
Ardour and splendour the Buddha's disciples art.
Persietence and patient endevour,
Building up the causes day and night,
Living up to our station of existence,
Disciples of the Tathāgata,
Blessed in practice's light.
Meditation on the loathsome,
Holding to each breath,
Death, decay at any moment,
Extinction of suffering Best.
So may we flow forward with the Dhamma,
The ocean, Nibbana's edge.
